version.title: Version 1.0.b1
version.item: FAE is now based on the Django web application framework written in the Python programming language. As in previous versions, it also consists of an analysis engine written in Objective CAML and a PostgreSQL DBMS.

New rules have been added, and existing rules modified, based on the IITAA Implementation Guidelines. These include all rules in the Titles, Subheadings and Form Controls subsections of the Navigation & Orientation section of Page and Sitewide Reports.

Manage Reports feature: As in previous versions, reports created by authenticated users are automatically purged after a certain number of days. However, a user may now select up to five reports (by default) to be permanently archived. Additionally, the last five reports that have been generated but not marked for permanent archiving are also saved.
Run FAE changes: The default Run FAE form for authenticated users now accepts only a single URL. To analyze multiple URLs, select the Multiple URLs link in the top menu bar.
Page Report header information now includes the Page Title content.
The URL for linking directly to FAE has changed. Please see the About FAE: Overview page for details.
